In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for (i, word) in enumerate(words)
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) <= text_width
            # Add the word to the current line
            wrapped_text *= word * " "
        else
            # Add a newline and the word as the start of a new line
            wrapped_text *= "\n" * word * " "
        end
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```
Example usage:
```julia
text = "This is an example sentence for testing the wrap_string function."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This will output the wrapped text, maintaining a maximum width of 10 characters per line (excluding spaces and newlines).
